intro: Strophostyles, commonly known as water ferns, are aquatic or semi-aquatic plants belonging to the family Marsileaceae. Strophostyles species are known for their ability to thrive in nutrient-rich soils and their role in stabilizing aquatic ecosystems. Their reproductive structures, including small flowers and fruits, contribute to their ecological significance in wetland habitats.
